poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Kith is thicker than water, Thicker than porter, older than blood. A crith of a life will last - a slither of Gold from the lith of a finger Into the zither of the tilth, Found by a smith in the horse's mouth. The filth is buried with us, and our rhythm Dithers and goes. The pith of our decision Withers out by the fifth or sixth "begat". If anything survives the hither and Thithering waters of - it's pure gold, pure myth.
